input: user: I require assistance in drafting a Shakespearean style farewell speech to bid adieu to a beloved colleague.

Dear colleague, thou art departed from our midst,
And for awhile, thy memory shall we not cherish.
'Tis fate's decree that brings an end to thine
Time with us, and thus, our bond of office be undone.

Nay, let not sorrow creep into thine heart's dark place,
For in the realm of memory, thou shalt find a brighter space,
Where wisdom, kindness, and thy noble deeds dost sit.
And though we part, know that in my heart, thou shalt be there.

I do beseech thee, in thy absence, to take heed
Of all the tasks assigned unto poor me,
To complete them with care, and honor of the deed,
That future times may not behold a vacant glee.

And thou, dear friend, whom I have striven to please,
Willst make it through this dark hour still, unbeset by tears.
May Fortune smile upon thee, as she shals on me.
Then know thyself, and let thine own heart set thee free.

Thus ending this our fleeting office bond,
May our paths cross o'er in future's grand plan.
